page.title: 01Survey of Ditchling Area.
page.content: Our block is rural and contains part of three administrative parishes; Ditchling,Westmeston and Streat which are divided by minor roads running from north to south and linked by a network of footpaths. Agriculture minly grazing,is widely represented and there are a number of small fruit farms and a flourishing vineyard.In the western corner lies Ditchling with many attractions for the visitor including a museum of local history and many buildings of historic interest.There is a primary school in Ditchling and a rural training centre for the handicapped at Westmeston.The tiny hamlet of Streat has a small working sandpit as a band of greensand crosses the area.The population is scattered and sparse apart from the village of Ditchling.
